intro: Luetzelburgia pterocarpoides, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fragrant white flowers that open at night. The plant has compound leaves and produces pods that contain edible seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its unique blooming pattern and ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
